sub_title: Materials Process Engineer | Analytical Methods Development & Validation | Semiconductors processing | Materials Characterization | Microscopy & Imaging Expert | Project & Team Management | Cross-functional collaborator
summary:
A passionate interdisciplinary researcher with an eye for detail, exploring novel avenues in materials fabrication, processing, and characterization for healthcare, optics, renewable energy, and environmental monitoring sectors.

🔬 Transforming concepts into reality:  Leveraging 10+ years of global experience to excel in research design (DOE), project management, and technical leadership. Skilled in strategic project planning, risk analysis, technical mentoring and fostering cross-functional collaborations.

🌟 Core Strengths:

- Project planning and leadership
- Expertise in experimental design and troubleshooting
- Proficient in regulatory documentation (SOP), technical reports and risk assessment protocols
- Collaborative team player and strong relationship builder
- Exceptional problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical data driven decision making skills
- Proven track record in scientific project leadership and team mentoring

🌐 Thriving in diverse, dynamic work environments: Adaptable and Agile, adept at cutting-edge techniques and fostering collaborative partnerships.

🛠️ Technical Mastery:
- Materials synthesis (metals, semiconductors, polymers, biomolecules), solution processing (wet-chemistry, surface treatment), chemical etching/cleaning of silicon wafers, and thin-film deposition (PVD, ALD, CVD, Epitaxy - MOCVD, MBE, Plasma sputtering) for optical sensors, optical coatings, photovoltaics, optoelectronics device applications.
- Structural characterization (TEM, HAADF-STEM, FIB-SEM, EDS, XRD, NMR, surface analysis - XPS, Ellipsometry, EBIC-SEM)
- Optical metrology (UV-Vis, FTIR, Raman, Fluorescence, Confocal Fluorescence Microscopy, DLS, CD)
- Electrochemical analysis (Cyclic Voltammetry, Impedance spectroscopy)

Let's connect and explore the possibilities at the intersection of science/tech innovation and impact!! 🌐

Mechanics of particles,rigid bodies and continuous media

profile_positions.description:
My current research focuses on single-molecule detection using plasmonic and fluorescent approaches. By combining concepts from single-molecule microscopy, plasmonics, super-resolution microscopy (single molecule localization microscopy:SMLM, DNA mediated super-resolution microscopy: DNA-PAINT, qPAINT) and Electrodynamics modelling, I aim to develop novel sensing concepts and study biomolecular (protein-protein, protein-DNA, dye-DNA) interactions in complex microenvironments.

• Analytical Methods Testing & Development: Validated and optimized sample preparation protocols (assay development) involving biofunctionalization of nanoparticle surfaces with DNA, proteins, polymers suited for single-molecule nano-biosensing.

• Project & Team Management: Supervised and coordinated a cross-functional team of 5 Ph.D. researchers working in 5 different projects under the ERC grant by bridging the gap between cross-disciplines to solve scientific research problems. Administered weekly & monthly project planning for project members of the ERC team.

• Complex Data Analysis: Collected bulk data using high-end instruments like confocal fluorescence, super-resolution microscopy, hyperspectral imaging. Systematically evaluated and critically analyzed complex datasets involving statistical data analysis (Matlab, OriginPro) ; image processing (ImageJ & Python based GUIs).
profile_positions.title: Materials And Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Primarily involved with colloidal synthesis, solution processing (wet chemistry, wet chemical etching), epitaxy (MBE, MOCVD) growth of semiconductor nanocrystals (quantum dots- type II-VI, III-V, perovskites, GaN, InAs, InGaN) on silicon wafers for developing prototype photovoltaic and optoelectronic devices based on quantum dot-perovskite hybrid heterojunctions. Performed correlative structure-property characterization  (XRD, XPS, SEM, TEM, KPM, SPV, EBIC-SEM, I-V) using advanced optical imaging (time-correlated single-photon counting, photon cross-correlation spectroscopy, FCS) and electron microscopic methods.

• Materials Design & Development: Designed, developed wet-chemistry based synthetic methods for perovskite-quantum dot hybrid semiconductor nanocrystals as functional materials for thin-film photovoltaics and optoelectronic devices 

• Analytical Methods Testing & Development: Developed and tested thin film fabrication methods using spin-coating, ultrahigh vacuum deposition and thermal evaporation for colloidal nanocrystal based energy devices. Evaluated correlation between device performance and processing parameters on hybrid semiconductor LEDs.

• Project Management: Demonstrated project management skills and fostered international scientific collaboration across 3 continents (Europe, Asia & South America) resulting in successful completion of 2 challenging projects and as evidenced by 4 technical publications.

• Complex Data Analysis: Gained technical literacy in the field by collecting key-metrics, complex scientific data analysis, drafted research progress reports and delivered presentations to research collaborators. Formulated in grant writing to external funding agencies leading to an international (ISF-NSFC) collaborative grant with a budget of $600,000.
profile_positions.title: Semiconductor Engineer

profile_positions.description:
A collaborative scientific partnership between the Weizmann Institute of Science, Israel and Universität Jaume I, Spain for materials/ methods development and device fabrication of solution-processed (wet chemical etching, solution processed surface treatment) thin films (using ultrahigh vacuum deposition methods : PVD, CVD, MOCVD) based on hybrid quantum dots-perovskites on silicon wafers for photovoltaics (tandem multi-junction perovskite solar cells) and on flexible substrates for optoelectronics (GaN, InAlN, InAs, perovskite-QD hybrid based nano-LEDs, micro-LEDs) applications.

Technical skills acquired:

• Thin film deposition (spin-coating, spray-coating, PVD, MOCVD) of electron & hole transport layers for fabricating perovskite based photovoltaic and optoelectronic devices

• In-solution and solid-state ligand exchange and surface chemistry treatment on Perovskite-QD hybrids for efficient charge carrier extraction/recombination

• Complete device fabrication and assessment of device quality/performance testing (solar cells & LEDs) based on Perovskite-QD Hybrids

• Solar cell characterization using Newport (Keithley 2600 series) solar simulator (I-V curve, FF, VOC, JSC, PCE) and LED characterization (EQE using integrating sphere)

• Optical and Electrical characterization, Device efficiency and Device Modeling (software: PC1D, TandemCalc) of Quantum dots based-LEDs and Perovskite solar cells
profile_positions.title: Device Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Contributed research to the team as RA (research assistant) and mentored/supervised (Masters, PhD) students in scientific research. 

• Configuring & Maintaining Instrumentation: Acted as the de facto equipment specialist for a team of 10 researchers, configuring and maintaining a variety of lab equipment (vacuum pumps, spin-coater, centrifuges, chemical reactors), complex optical setups (microscopes, spectrometers, and lasers) to facilitate their use in scientific research.  

• Analytical Methods Testing & Development: Spearheaded with initial design and development of optical lab setups. Acted as liaison in purchase negotiation between instrument vendors and team budget committee.

• Materials Design & Development: Synthesized high-quality quantum dots (>95% quantum efficiency), metal nanoparticle-quantum dot hybrids and functional. Performed in-depth materials analyses and evaluated structure-property relation using XRD, FTIR & microscopy (confocal fluorescence, Raman, SEM, FIB-SEM, EDS, HRTEM, HAADF-STEM) techniques.

• Project Management: Acquired project management skills  through successful and timely completion of 4 projects resulting in 9 peer-reviewed technical publications. 

Research areas:
1. Wet-chemistry synthesis and surface treatment of visible and near-IR emitting semiconductor nanocrystals, functional optical thin film coatings (using ultrahigh vacuum deposition: ALD, PVD) and correlative materials structure-property characterization using high resolution electron and optical microscopy.

2. Photophysical characterization of single quantum dots using Confocal Fluorescence Microscopy, Time Correlated Single Photon Counting and Photon Cross-Correlation spectroscopic methods.

3. Optoelectronic characterization and investigating plasmon-exciton coupling, higher-order quantum correlation in single quantum dots using Dark-Field Scattering Microscopy, Confocal Fluorescence Microscopy, FCS, Photon-Correlation Spectroscopy.
profile_positions.title: Materials Specialist

profile_positions.description:
• Technical trainer/ Mentorship: Acted as TA (teaching assistant) with assisting academic faculties in their pedagogical activities. Gained teaching and training/mentorship experience by teaching and counselling 200 undergraduate students on methods to optimize learning and understanding the course material. 

# Taught several semesters of various levels of general chemistry and analytical chemistry courses to undergraduate students.

# Primary responsibilities included teaching three-hour discussion sessions, lab demonstrations, preparing quizzes, and proctoring and grading exams,- holding office hours to help out the students with their course questionnaire, solving numerical problems.
profile_positions.title: Academic Mentor

profile_positions.description:
• Technical Training and Mentorship: Proactively supervised 2 Masters, 2 PhD students resulting in successful completion of 2 publications and 2 project dissertations.

• Project and Resource Management: Responsibilities included project designing, risk and failure analysis, strategic consulting, technical instrument training and supervising, co-mentoring 2 REU (Research Experience for the Undergraduates funded by NSF) students on projects related to "Synthesis and Optical Characterization of Colloidal Semiconductor Nanocrystals for Biological Applications"
profile_positions.title: Student Research Mentor

profile_positions.description: Synthesis and Characterization of Salen-based Metal-Organic frameworks(MOFs) using single crystal XRD,NMR,IR spectroscopy.
profile_positions.title: Junior Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Electron Transfer reactions in heterogeneous micellar media within supramolecular self-assemblies using techniques like Fluorescence Anisotropy,Fluorescence Up-conversion,Dynamic Light Scattering,CV,Small Angle Neutron Scattering.
